data.question: What is the main focus of the coordination chemistry mentioned in the text?
data.answer: Metallohelicates

data.question: What type of ligands were used for the selective assembly of heterobimetallic helical complexes?
data.answer: Mixed benzene-o-dithiol/catechol ligands

data.question: What is the role of directional ligands in the synthesis of helical complexes?
data.answer: They are used to bridge different donor groups or identical donor groups with asymmetric spacers for the assembly of helical complexes.

data.question: Can the {Mo(bdt)3} polyhedra adopt different configurations based on the oxidation state of the metal center?
data.answer: True

data.question: What method was used to characterize the dinuclear complex (PNP)4[TiMo(1)3] (2 a)?
data.answer: NMR spectroscopy and X-ray diffraction analysis

data.question: Is the formation of N(cid:1)H···S hydrogen bonds observed for the first time in the [TiMo(1)3)]4(cid:1) anions?
data.answer: True

data.question: What influences the aggregation of helicates of type [TiMo(1)3]4(cid:1)?
data.answer: The nature and number of available alkali metal cations

data.question: Does the complex {L,L-[TiMo(1)3]-(PNP)-D,D-[TiMo(1)3]}7(cid:1) contain enantiomers in its crystal lattice?
data.answer: True

data.question: What results from the reaction of three equivalents of H4-1 with one equivalent each of [TiO(acac)2] and [MoCl4(CH3CN)2]?
data.answer: A dark green solution indicating the formation of a heterobimetallic complex

data.question: Are the geometric parameters of the anions [TiMo(1)3]4(cid:1) in complexes 2 a and 2 b significantly different?
data.answer: False

data.question: What does the presence of lithium cations in the crystallization experiments indicate?
data.answer: Their importance for the stereoselective self-organization of dinuclear triple-stranded helicates

data.question: What is the significance of the helical twist measurement in the complexes?
data.answer: It indicates the degree of helicity and orientation of the ligand strands in the complexes.

data.question: Is the C3-symmetry preserved for the helical anion of complex 2 b?
data.answer: False

data.question: What does the formation of strong N(cid:1)H···O and N(cid:1)H···S hydrogen bonds in the [TiMo(1)3)]4(cid:1) anions suggest about the geometry of the {Mo(bdt)} moiety?
data.answer: It suggests that the {Mo(bdt)} moiety has a planar geometry.

data.question: What future experiments are mentioned in the text?
data.answer: Experiments designed to reveal whether the {MIV(bdt)3} polyhedra in helicates can be oxidized to give trigonal-prismatic MoVI species.

data.question: Does the text mention the use of alkali metal cations in the synthesis of helicates?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of lithium and sodium cations on the aggregation of helical anions in complex 2 b?
data.answer: They lead to the formation of a polymeric network in the solid state.

data.question: What is the role of the PNP cation in the aggregation of helicates in complex 2 a?
data.answer: It bridges two enantiomeric helicates through interactions, leading to a tetranuclear unit.

data.question: Are the helical anions of type [TiMo(1)3]4(cid:1) formed as a pair of racemic L,L and D,D stereoisomers?
data.answer: True

data.question: What does the downfield shift of the signals of the amide protons in complex 2 a indicate?
data.answer: The formation of strong N(cid:1)H···O and N(cid:1)H···S hydrogen bonds
